meanings.definition: A diagnostic procedure that uses X-rays to visualize veins in the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor ordered venograms to see inside the patient's veins.
meanings.sent2: The technician carefully analyzed the venograms to identify any blockages.
meanings.sent3: During the venogram, the veins seemed to dance under the X-ray's gaze.
meanings.sent4: The venograms revealed a hidden network of rivers flowing through the patient's body.
meanings.sent5: The vivid venograms painted a clear picture of the circulatory system.

meanings.definition: The images produced by a venogram.
meanings.sent1: The venograms displayed a detailed map of the patient's veins.
meanings.sent2: Doctors studied the venograms to understand the blood flow patterns.
meanings.sent3: The venograms looked like a mysterious puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a collection of venograms, each image representing a different memory.
meanings.sent5: The venograms were like windows into the hidden world beneath the skin.

meanings.definition: To perform a venogram on a patient.
meanings.sent1: The medical team will venogram the patient to diagnose the issue.
meanings.sent2: She venograms patients regularly to ensure their vein health.
meanings.sent3: The doctor joked that he could venogram in his sleep, he was so experienced.
meanings.sent4: As the surgeon began to venogram, the room filled with focused silence.
meanings.sent5: To truly understand, you must venogram with your own hands.
